title: Is there any way to run league like its in Windows 7 from Windows 10?
body: Recently I "upgraded" my computer to Windows 10. Now as a long time League player, I got very used to the way it ran on Windows 7, and it kind of feels more laggy and janky on Windows 10. So, is there any way to make it look, and play like it does on Windows 7 without downgrading?

replies.body: Ok i went and tried compatibility mode, which didnt change much and i have yet to try ddu, but will prob try it later today

If you're having FPS issues, use DDU (Display Driver Uninstaller) to completely uninstall your video driver, then reinstall it after restarting your computer. This is the change that made the biggest difference for me. :)

I can't remember which other changes I had to make after upgrading to 10, but if you want to list anything that feels like it could be better, I might be able to offer more fixes.

Windows does offer compatibility mode when running specific programs.  To do this, find your League of Legends executable, right click and select "properties".  Once a new window opens up, find the "compatibility" tab, and checkmark "Run this program in compatibility mode for:".  Once done, select Windows 7.

You should be good to go then!  Let me know if you have any further questions!
